com.xilinx.rapidwright.device

Class Site

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xilinx.rapidwright.device.Site
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Site
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class represents the primitive sites found in XDLRC files. Theses represent places on the FPGA where a particular instance of a primitive (or XDL 'inst') can reside.
    Author:
    Chris Lavin
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Gets and returns the name of this primitive site (ex: SLICE_X4Y6).
        Returns:
        The unique name of this primitive site.

      • setName

        protected void setName(java.lang.String name)
        Sets the name of this primitive site (ex: SLICE_X5Y7).
        Parameters:
        name - the name to set.

      • getNameSpacePrefix

        public java.lang.String getNameSpacePrefix()
        Gets a new string representation of the site type's namespace. For example SLICEL and SLICEM map to SLICE_. Other types generally just map to their site type name.
        Returns:
        The site type namespace (includes trailing underscore).

        Gets and returns the wire name of the given pin name.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getTileWireIndexFromPinName

        public int getTileWireIndexFromPinName(java.lang.String pinName)
        Get the wire index connected to the pin provided.
        Parameters:
        pinName - Name of the pin on the site to get its connecting wire.
        Returns:
        The wire index within the tile that is connected to the pin provided.

        public Node getConnectedNode(java.lang.String pinName)
        Creates and returns the corresponding node that connects to specified site pin provided.
        Parameters:
        pinName - Name of the site pin in question.
        Returns:
        A new Node object that is the node the connects externally to this site pin.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        A new Node object that is the node the connects externally to this site pin.

        public ElementType getElement(java.lang.String name)

      • getInstanceX

        public int getInstanceX()
        Gets and returns the integer X value of the instance location (ex: SLICE_X5Y10, it will return 5).
        Returns:
        The X integer value of the site name or -1 if this instance is not placed or does not have X/Y coordinates in the site name.

      • getInstanceY

        public int getInstanceY()
        Gets and returns the integer Y value of the instance location (ex: SLICE_X5Y10, it will return 10).
        Returns:
        The Y integer value of the site name or -1 if this instance is not placed or does not have X/Y coordinates in the site name.

      • getRpmX

        public int getRpmX()
        Gets the RPM X coordinate of this site instance
        Returns:

        Gets the RPM Y coordinate of this site instance
        Returns:

      • hasPin

        public boolean hasPin(java.lang.String pinName)

      • isCompatibleSiteType

        public boolean isCompatibleSiteType(SiteTypeEnum otherType)
        This method will check if the SiteTypeEnum otherType can be placed at this primitive site. Most often only if they are equal can this be true. However there are a few special cases that require extra handling. For example a SLICEL can reside in a SLICEM site but not vice versa.
        Parameters:
        otherType - The primitive type to try to place on this site.
        Returns:
        True if otherType can be placed at this primitive site, false otherwise.

      • getNeighborSite

        public Site getNeighborSite(int dx,
                            int dy)
        This will attempt to locate a neighbor site of similar type (pblock-compatible) with the provided X,Y offset. For example, if this method was called on the site SLICE_X2Y2.getNeighborSite(-1,3), it should return the site SLICE_X1Y5, if it exists in the device.
        Parameters:
        dx - The X offset of the desired neighbor site.
        dy - The Y offset of the desired neighbor site.
        Returns:
        The neighbor site at the specified offset, or null if it couldn't be found.

      • isCompatibleSiteType

        public boolean isCompatibleSiteType(Site otherSite)
        This method gets the type of otherSite and calls the other method public boolean isCompatibleSiteType(SiteTypeEnum otherType); See that method for more information.
        Parameters:
        otherSite - The other site to see if its type is compatible with this site.
        Returns:
        True if compatible, false otherwise.
